issue.title: Web panel cannot fetch streams and VoD files after JWT filtering is set for both the server and the application.
issue.body:
### Short description The admin panel fails to fetch a list of live streams and VoD files when the REST API for both a server and an app requires a valid JSON web token. There are plenty of warning messages on a yellow background saying "You are not allowed to access this resource". ![image](https://github.com/ant-media/Ant-Media-Server/assets/71029984/a809080d-e171-4e7a-804c-359bf42c9acd) ### Environment * Operating system and version: Ubuntu 22.04 * Ant Media Server version: 2.6.3 ### Steps to reproduce 1. Enable JWT filtering for both a streaming app and the antmedia server. 2. Perform the request 
curl -v -X 'Authentication: {jwt}' "https://{antmedia-server}:5443/rest/v2/request?_path=LiveApp/rest/v2/broadcasts/list/0/10&sort_by=&order_by="
where `{jwt}` is encoded with the secret key for the application (confirmed by checking the failed request in the browser). The response is 403 with a message **Invalid Server JWT Token**. 3. Perform the same request but with JWT encoded with the server secret key. The response is still 403, but with a message **Invalid App JWT Token**. 4. Disable now the JWT filtering for the server, but keep JWT filtering for the streaming app. The first request is now successful. Likewise, the yellow notifications do not appear anymore and the list of streams is visible in the web admin panel. ### Expected behavior Enabling JWT filtering for both the server and streaming apps should have no effect on the web admin panel.

commits.message: Fix accessing rest api when app and server REST jwt token is enabled

Merge pull request #5740 from ant-media/enable-jwt-token-on-webpane-by-default

Fix JWT token confusion between applications and server web panel

pull_request.title: Fix JWT token confusion between applications and server web panel

repo.name: Ant-Media-Server
repo.description: Ant Media Server is a live streaming engine software that provides adaptive, ultra low latency streaming by using WebRTC technology with ~0.5 seconds latency. Ant Media Server is auto-scalable and it can run on-premise or on-cloud.

issue.title: WHIP (WebRTC HTTP Ingest Protocol)
issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
we keep experiencing network issues when attempting to stream using RTMP from Australia to Ant media server in North America. 

**Describe the solution you'd like**
The ability to ingest RTSP over HTTP directly using Gstreamer or similar  

**Additional context**
similar to Millicast https://docs.millicast.com/docs/using-gstreamer-with-millicast

pull_request.title: Enable jwt token on webpane by default

repo.name: Ant-Media-Server
repo.description: Ant Media Server is a live streaming engine software that provides adaptive, ultra low latency streaming by using WebRTC technology with ~0.5 seconds latency. Ant Media Server is auto-scalable and it can run on-premise or on-cloud.

repo.name: Ant-Media-Server
repo.description: Ant Media Server is a live streaming engine software that provides adaptive, ultra low latency streaming by using WebRTC technology with ~0.5 seconds latency. Ant Media Server is auto-scalable and it can run on-premise or on-cloud.

payload.description: Ant Media Server is a live streaming engine software that provides adaptive, ultra low latency streaming by using WebRTC technology with ~0.5 seconds latency. Ant Media Server is auto-scalable and it can run on-premise or on-cloud.

issue.title: GPU Memory leak - some amount of memory is not freed after stream finish

comment.body: I have also replicated this problem. It seems that there are no issues with RTMP, but the problem only arises when using WebRTC. Specifically, memory is not released when the publishing process is stopped.

issue.title: Case Investigation - Recording issue via Labrus RTSP Camera
issue.body:
### Short description
Their are some RTSP feeds published on a server via Labrus RTSP cameras. Their is no issue with the live stream, but recording for this specific camera is not fine. Sometimes size is in gigabytes, but recording is only a few seconds, and sometimes recording duration shows more than the original duration.

### Environment
* Ant Media Server version: v2.6.0 and above

### Steps to reproduce
1. Enable the mp4 recording on the server
2. Pull RTSP camera feed from Labrus camera and record for at least 1 hour
3. Stop the stream and check the recording.

### Expected behavior
Recording should be fine.

### Actual behavior
Recording is not fine, as described in the issue description.

commits.message: Refactor muxAdaptor type to have better concurrency and efficiency

issue.title: YouTube streaming abruptly stops after few days.
issue.body:
### Short description

I'm running some 24/7 livestreams to YouTube, and every couple of days, give or take, one of them will drop off and my stream will shut down. It's excruciating watching weeks of analytical progress be deleted because of this.

Whenever it happens, I check my ant media server and inevitably, the playlist that was being stream will have broadcasting lowered to 0.01x. Stopping the broadcast and starting it again will bring it back to normal.
I have no idea what the cause is, and am very limited in my knowledge of these things, if someone could please assist, I'll be what use I can with a little guidance. Thank you!

### Environment

* Operating system and version:
* Java version: 
* Ant Media Server version:
* Browser name and version:

### Steps to reproduce
1. Start Live Streaming to youtube
2. wait for couple of days



### Logs

Ask your questions on [Ant Media Github Discussions](https://github.com/orgs/ant-media/discussions)

issue.title: SRT Ingest does not reconnect after connection loss
issue.body:
### Short description

If there is a sudden and short-lived connection loss during RTMP ingestion, the connection is re-established, however, if the same happens when ingesting SRT, the connection is broken and does not recover. 

Either there is a very small reconnection window with SRT or none at all. 

FFMPEG 

```
ffmpeg -re -stream_loop -1 -i bigbuckbunny.mp4 -c:v libx264 -c:a aac -f flv rtmp://ant-media-server/LiveApp/stream1
```
SRT

```
ffmpeg -re -stream_loop -1 -i ./bigbuckbunny.mp4 -vcodec libx264 -profile:v baseline -g 60 -an -f mpegts "srt://ant-media-server:4200?streamid=LiveApp/stream1"
```

Simulate connection loss for 10 seconds by running the shell script during ingestion

```
#!/bin/bash
sudo tc qdisc add dev eth0 root netem loss 100%
sleep $1
sudo tc qdisc del dev eth0 root
```


### Environment

* Operating system and version: ubuntu 22
* Java version: 
* Ant Media Server version: 2.6.4
* Browser name and version: none

### Steps to reproduce
1. Use either of the FFMPEG commands above to start streaming
2. during live streaming execute the shell script on the ingest server
3. observe how SRT disconnects completely whereas RTMP resumes live streaming once the script has completed

### Expected behavior
Either ingestion method should recover the live stream after a short-lived connection loss.

### Actual behavior
Only RTMP reconnects. 

 


### Logs
__Place logs on [pastebin](http://pastebin.com/) or elsewhere and put links here__

Ask your questions on [Ant Media Github Discussions](https://github.com/orgs/ant-media/discussions)

comment.body: Looks like SRT timeout is 5 seconds https://github.com/ant-media/Ant-Media-Server/issues/4434

issue.title: Android SDK Multitrack Conference Join-Rejoin Does Not Work Correctly
issue.body:
In the Android SDK multitrack conference, when a participant joins and then subsequently leaves the conference, their video feed is not properly cleared; instead, it becomes frozen. Furthermore, when they rejoin the conference, their video feed does not appear correctly; it remains frozen.

The expected behavior in this scenario is as follows: When a user leaves the conference, their video feed should be cleared, and upon rejoining, their video feed should be added correctly, without remaining frozen.

This issue is being observed in AMS 2.7.0
